p: In Brazil, arbovirus monitoring using RT-PCR in larvae of Aedes spp. is performed sporadically by some surveys ( 17) and is not used as a routine tool in arbovirus control programs. The RT-PCR has several advantages, such as rapid detection, sensitivity, and specificity, and can be applied in the surveillance of arboviruses ( 37), especially when negative results are obtained by other tests, such as viral isolation in cell cultures ( 38). Our results confirmed the high level of sensitivity by RT-PCR in pools containing a smaller amount of Ae. aegypti, as obtained in other studies ( 27, 39).
